questions.question_text: What entry point type must a horizontal pattern have to execute from a process classifier?

choices.C: TCP entry point type or ALL entry point type.
choices.B: HTTP(S) entry point type if the pattern is running on a web server application.
choices.D: It does not matter, it is triggered for all entry point types.

questions.question_text: Which best describes Discovery schedule of type Configuration Item?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct Answer C
A and C are very close, the only ambiguity is the verification (Does CMDB do verification accepting CI's )

choices.B: Creates only a list of discovered IPs in both IPv4 and IPv6 formats.
choices.C: Collects complete information from the scanned IP ranges and sends it to the CMDB.
choices.A: Verifies Configuration Item data from the scanned IP ranges against the data in the CMDB.
choices.D: Directly populates records in the assets table.

questions.question_text: Which metrics comprise the Completeness KPI for CMDB Health? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Completeness: CIs are tested for required and recommended fields that are not populated.

questions.question_text: Which of the following choices explain differences between Service Mapping and Discovery? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Discovery requires agent installation to find hardware devices, Service Mapping requires agents for software.
choices.D: Discovery addresses inventory-related use-cases, while Service Mapping allows for the creation of accurate maps of application service topologies.
choices.B: Discovery finds applications and devices on your network, Service Mapping monitors those devices.
choices.C: Discovery utilizes IP address ranges for initial discovery, Service Mapping uses entry points.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
should be C and D, event management is used to monitor

Selected Answer: CD
Service Mapping does not "monitor" anything.

Selected Answer: CD
I would say C and D

Selected Answer: CD
C and D
